storyInfo: In her nightmare, Skadi tries to escape. Meanwhile, Anita insists on staying by her side. On the other end of the coast, the Inquisitors witness the truth behind the local ritual.

attributes.content: There is no end... The fog is everywhere...

attributes.text: A glowing mist rises from the bottomless abyss and engulfs her whole.
That instant, all her senses are cut off from the rest of the world.
Perhaps she can feel there is something right in front of her.
Before her is the entire ocean.
She puts her whole strength into striking the enormous yet almost shapeless object before her.
Everything she can feel immediately crumbles away.
An ice cold yet burning hot liquid swallows her. These are the ocean
The very last dance has concluded. The seas have calmed, and she can no longer hear her people
She saved... No, she has no idea what it is that she actually saved.
Likewise, she does not have the faintest idea what it is she triumphed over.

She paddles her arms and kicks her feet as though her life depends on it, yet the waters of the ocean pay no heed to her willpower. Like solid blocks of iron, the water has become cold and stiff, squeezing her body from all directions.
She stops moving, leaving herself to the mercy of the sea.
As she sinks further and further into the ocean, a black shadow envelops her.
The countless voices begin to materialize around her. Some of them are crying and some... are murmuring.
The sea is talking to her.
Its cold, lightless form has been restored, as have her eyes. She cannot see the path upward. She is sinking downward further and further, just as she is rising upward more and more.
At a place deeper than even the sea
She opens her lips. The saltwater gushes into her throat and dissolves her completely before reconstructing her anew.
She has found her singing voice once more.

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Singer, you're awake! Good morning!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Was someone just singing?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I-Is this a song? I don't know how to sing, but you were humming this while you were asleep.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Ow! Singer... You are grabbing too hard...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: The girl
No, the one in the sea was someone else.
The dream is ripping her nerves to shreds.
The musical notes are dancing, twisting themselves into the cries of her family.

attributes.content: Mother...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: They are dying before her eyes, and there is nothing she can do to prevent it.

attributes.content: Monsters...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Monsters.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Monsters!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: They are screaming, as is everyone around her.
She must grab her weapon.

attributes.content: Ah!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: *cough*... Singer, your box... It's really hurting my chest when you press it against me...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.text: Her blade pierces through a monster in the midst of feeding on a person.
The monster turns around.
She sees a face she often sees in the mirror.
The box falls on the ground, bouncing slightly before it comes to a stop. The object stored therein tumbles inside the box a little but does not fall out.

attributes.content: A-Are you letting go? That really scared me...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Singer, I thought you were going to kill me.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: If I were going to kill you, I could've done that easily.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But you don't want to kill me.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You can tell?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I can tell.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: But I don't know.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: R-Running out again...? Singer, where are you going?!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Sir... The tides are rising again.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: The colors of the sea... That patch of color has changed.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: What is there in the water? I-Is it shells and finfish? Why would they suddenly show up in the water? And why are they growing closer and closer to the shore?
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: From far deeper places, they made their way here by following currents that normally would not exist.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: I thought... the reason they headed into the sea, claiming it would get them food, was some absurd, unfounded belief. I thought, in their despair, they were fooled into doing this...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: But I never imagined... they are actually dealing with the sea? They are using their own men as fodder to feed the monsters of the sea, and the monsters then also feed them in return?
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: This mutualism is horrifying... and wretched...! No wonder there are so many Sea Terrors here!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: But I thought I put an end to it yesterday...!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Not all corrections are fruitful. This is something you must understand.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Am I in the wrong, High Inquisitor? I just wanted to save them.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: To right a wrong, you either bring what strayed from righteousness back onto the right path—
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: But... What do the people here even see as right?
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: You can't grow any food in the lands and seas of Sal Viento anymore.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: This was a foregone conclusion decades ago, and to fight it would be futile. The nomadic city, the society, and the people who live in it... They are all slowly marching towards their death.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: They asked me... If... If there isn't a way out... How are they supposed to see right from wrong?
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: —Or perhaps make that which is wrong no more.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Sir...! You don't mean...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: You are doubting me.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: I... No, of course not. I just...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: They may have turned out like this... but they were once Iberian citizens. I want to protect them, and I hope I can help these inhabitants... so that they can make our country a better place.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: You should have doubts.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: In making a judgment, rely on no one but yourself!
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Yes, sir...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Look out at the sea. What do you see?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: I see... a threat.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Don't regurgitate your memorized answers.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: The sea... is flowing. It's ever changing.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Remember everything that you see.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Change has happened, is happening, and will happen. If you can't see it clearly for yourself, you will find yourself lost.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: Sir, what is that under your feet?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: A Sea Terror... Did we miss one when they attacked last night?! No, doesn't seem like it... This one wandered off the beach... It looks like it's climbed a long way... It's not quite the same...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: I... uh... I should know this...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: This is an evil that must be eradicated.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor

attributes.content: I get it... I can see it... It's the whole truth of this deal of theirs.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: So this is what becomes of anyone who wanders into the sea... This is not just the monsters' nest. It's their breeding ground.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: Doesn't that mean that all the people here will become monsters?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: (Grips scabbard)
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.content: High Inquisitor, I need to head back to the city.
attributes.name: Inquisitor

attributes.text: Skadi sits on the shore.
Carried by the winds, the sea waves beat the shore ceaselessly, but never reaching her dress.

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*... Phew... S-Singer, you're too fast...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: But not fast enough.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You managed to follow me again.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: H-Haha... Singer, this is my home... I know this place much better than you.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I should leave.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Leave? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I mean leave this place.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? Did you figure out where to go to find your friend?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: At the very least... I should keep my distance from you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? Why's that?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: The Inquisitor was right about one thing.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: She talked about a lot of things...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I am a danger to all of you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Because of what happened last night? You saved us, Singer. We are very thankful of what you did for us.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I saved you? Is that what you think?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: If I'd missed even one of the Sea Terrors, it could've torn you to pieces as it marched on.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You would've been killed.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I brought it here. Therefore, I killed you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No, that's not how it is...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: How is it not? This has happened before.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: They died because of me. They despised me, they were scared of me, and they blamed me for it.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: They... They were wrong!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You didn't mean to do that.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I didn't mean to?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: After all that, I'm not sure... anymore.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: She thinks back to her dream.
Ever since that final battle, she has had that dream countless of times.
The Abyssal Hunters never stay in one place. They always march forward.
Yet Skadi was trapped there.
She has no idea what is happening to her.

attributes.content: I thought that if I killed it, I would find the answer.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: Killing that gigantic monster.
Things would get better for everyone. No one would cry anymore, and no one would scream anymore.
She just had to kill it.
And she killed it...
Yet an even greater problem engulfed her.
The Abyssal Hunters never ask why. They simply do.
But Skadi wants to know why.
She has no idea what is happening to her.

attributes.content: Singer...? You don't look so good.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You are hurt, and you spent so much of your energy. You haven't completely recovered yet, have you?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You should come back with me and get some rest. You will feel much better once you get more sleep.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Why aren't you afraid of me?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Your grandmother called me a monster, while your friends all looked at me with animosity.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: These kinds of gazes are everywhere... I got used to them long ago.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But what about you? When you look at me, what do you see?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You... You are a singer.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: A singer. That's what I told you, and you believed it. That Inquisitor, on the other hand, did not. If I tell you I'm a monster now, will you believe me?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I won't...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Why are you always following me?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Anything that I can give you, you are free to take, yet you don't want them.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You don't want to kill me either.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: K-Kill you? No, Singer, why would I want to kill you?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: When I do something for you, you pay me something in return. It's always either that or the other way around.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Whenever you exchange something, there exists a promise. It's only when promises exist that there's trust.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Promise?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You don't know what that is.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Listen up. You helped me, so I will give you what you want. This is what a promise is.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I don't want anything...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You are lying.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I can smell as much with my nose as my eyes can see.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You told me this is your home, and that's how you know how to find me so quickly. That's a lie too.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: If you don't tell me the truth, I can't trust you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No, Singer, don't go!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It's not that I'm not telling the truth. I just... don't understand.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Singer, to all of us... To me, you are still a mystery. You came from the outside, and I've never met anyone like you...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You want to know how I guessed that you are here. It's not that I'm trying to lie. I'm just... embarrassed.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: This is... the outskirts. It's as far as it gets from the city.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I know that you are hiding from us, and I thought this is where you would probably come too if you wanted to run away.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: 'Too?'
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I come here often myself. Of course, I don't tell Sheetmetal or anyone. They aren't happy when they find me running this far away.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Look at that chunk over there. It's tall. I climb on there sometimes. The stronger the wind gets, the farther I can see.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You are curious about what's outside.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I don't know. I... I sometimes wonder about how it's like outside. It's pretty pointless, I know, and they kept telling me that too, so all I do is imagine it all by myself here.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: This is the furthest I've gone whenever I go outside to scavenge. Outside... There's nothing useful outside.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: If you're curious about what's outside, you just have to walk a little further.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I used to go to the west side. Sheetmetal would warn me that there were monsters outside, and we would die if we ever stepped out.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Singer, you are from the outside. I am following you around because I have lots and lots of questions... I want to know if what Sheetmetal said is actually true.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: If you head outside, you will die.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Phew... so it's true...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You aren't disappointed.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Singer, if I have the chance, I think I want to see it for myself.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It doesn't matter if there are monsters there... I don't think I'm scared of them.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The Inquisitor said I'm not afraid of monsters because I don't know what they would do to me.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I think she's right about that.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: She made that up.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I'm not afraid of them either.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Haha... That's gotta be because you know the monsters can't do anything to you.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Not like me. Last night was the first time I got a good look of those monsters. I didn't know what was going to happen to me. My heart was racing like never before.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Then, when I woke up this morning, the weather felt so much better than I've ever experienced. I could feel the wind, and I could see the sea waves splashing ever closer.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: This day has been different than all the other days I've lived, because I don't know what's going to happen.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Sounds like you're excited.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Excited?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Fear and excitement are pretty much the same. Both get your heart racing and your blood flowing.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Am I sick?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You are not sick. To some people out there, this is what it means to be alive.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I didn't know it feels this good to be alive. Is it like this outside every day?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It must feel better than here.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Can I really go outside...?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: My box... Once my box is full.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I need to... get more food. I need to make sure Grandma Petra's all set.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: I... Argh!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.text: Excited, the girl loses her footing.
Just as she is about to fall into the sea, a hand reaches out and grabs her.

attributes.content: The monsters will eat you if you're so careless.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Singer... you saved me again.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: And you could've saved me the trouble if you didn't come.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Haha... S-Sorry...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Huh? Huh?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: My leg... Something's grabbing my leg.
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: It's slippery... and heavy!
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: There they are again... Everywhere, too. What a pain.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Ugh... Singer, I-I'm losing my grip...
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: Close your eyes.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: And then let go.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Can I really...?
attributes.name: Anita

attributes.content: You can either believe me or not. The choice is yours.
attributes.name: Skadi
